modules.description: Creates a mutable buffer of characters and provides operations to initialize, reset, determine length, and extract substrings. Works with a custom type `t` representing the buffer. Used to efficiently build and manipulate string fragments during text processing tasks.

Provides functions to create and manage a pool of pre-allocated buffers, supporting allocation, release, and size-based grouping. Operates on buffer structures that encapsulate raw byte data and metadata. Used to optimize memory usage in high-throughput network applications by reusing buffer instances.

Manages pre-allocated byte buffers for efficient memory reuse, supporting creation, resetting, and sub-buffer extraction. Operates on a custom buffer type that stores raw byte data. Used to minimize garbage collection pressure in high-throughput network or file I/O operations.
